definition: intolerable/unacceptable
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
to demand/to request/to coerce
(negative prefix)/not/no
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

sentences.english: A revolutionary should not think that way.
sentences.chinese: 這對一個革命者來說是要不得的。

definition: to cause a lot of trouble/to inflict much suffering
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to overcorrect (idiom)/to overcompensate
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
extreme (usu. of thoughts, speech, circumstances)
to harm sb/to inflict suffering/to victimize/pernicious
to harm others without benefiting oneself (idiom)
to lack foresight
not worth it
to do evil/to commit sins
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
to have disastrous consequences
to let emotions affect one's decisions
to be impervious to reason (idiom)/unreasonable
lit. say three in the morning but four in the evening (idiom); to change sth that is already settled upon/indecisive/to blow hot and cold
as soon as possible/at the first opportunity/the sooner the better/before it's too late
